intro: Anthopterus mucronatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thornplant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, spiny stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small, yellow, and clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and along riverbanks.
